title: @Riot, isn't it about time to remove/rework Frozen Mallet?
body:
{{item:3022}} Has been a problematic item for as long as I can remember as abuse cases pop up every once in a while, making a lot of player's lives hell.

It is an item, that does not provide a lot of intuitive gameplay and is most usually built in order to screw with immobile champions and/or melee champions while making the champions building it nigh-untouchable and inescapable.

And unlike {{item:3116}} the slow applies on every auto attack and isn't bound to hitting a spell, while also having more stats tied to it AND having a higher slow amount, DOUBLE that of rylais for melee champions.

{{champion:150}} {{champion:17}} {{champion:85}}  With Mallet are some of the worst experiences to play against and Gnar in particular is being kept weak simply because he can really abuse the item to become the undisputed king of top lane whenever he's strong.

Hell, even our favorite Weeb Samurai {{champion:157}} builds it, usually as his CORE, giving him even more sticking power.

In fact, I think Mallet does provide these champions with a way to overcome their inherent weaknesses that they were balanced around like most of the ranged ones being weak to being collapsed on.

So, isn't it about time to remove this item or at least rework it while finally being able to balance these champions around something that isn't a gimmicky item?

replies.body: Teemo using it scarred me mentally
Teemo scars me mentally

And he's hard countered by it too if you think about it.

lol, I loved it in season 5 when I could have 2k health by level 6 on sion by using his passive in the jungle and just building health items and bami's cinder XD

would be nice, juggernauts could use a rework for it to be more favorable towards them rather than mobile/ranged %%%%s like gnar and yasuo, but how do we go about doing that such that what's usable for them isn't cancer on another group of champions
Gnar is supposed to get it tbh. What else will he get if all the slows he has in his kit to kite his enemies is q?

He'd have to actually land Qs, god forbid.

It's also not like you wouldn't buff him in other ways anyway.

How is he supposed to kite while managing to position himself to grab the Q? Of course as a Gnar main I can do it but it takes tons of skill and muscle memory to throw it correctly while still being able to kite. Not only that but it is just 1 slow ability with a relatively high CD.

The thing is that the slow on his Q is not the only kite mechanic in Gnars kit.
Mini-Gnars **entire** kit is about kiting.

Q: Slows all enemies hit
W: Permanent movement speed buff as long as you keep proccing it
E: Hop, can even jump over an enemy trying to block the way

Especially since his W doesn't have a CD unlike most other 3-hit-passives, he can be pretty frustrating for immobile champions (basically uncatchable). Please don't act like slows are the only kiting mechanic in this game, dashes and movement speed buffs are just as well.....
Exactly this, Frozen Mallet just pushes his kitting power over the edge.

His W simply speeds him up. He needs to land 3 autos within his short range, assuming the ADC did not flash previously, in order to proc it. You act like he can pull W procs out his ass when in reality he can't. Mallet is completely acceptable on him. He is supposed to build it. Again, his E has a relatively large cooldown so that is often used as an escape, I would never use it as an engage since I am not an assassin and probably won't get out alive. I'm not arguing whether it is fair or not, I am simply saying that frozen Mallet is essential for Gnar because the rest of his kit does not provide enough kiting tools compared to other kiters. I will say this though, the correct combo can be done to slow, proc W, rinse and repeat. You are correct in the fact that there is a way I can continuously stick to my enemy but the combo is situational and needs to have the rest of the enemy team away.

Yes, his W "simply speeds him up". How does that contradict that it is a kiting mechanic?
In the end, both fulfill one task: increasing your movement speed in comparison to the enemy's.
Did you ever fight a crit build Jhin in late game? Every AA gives him MS buff and he is insanely good at kiting because of that then.

I didn't actually say that you should use E to engage. Except in team fights when you are going to transform, then you can actually make sick plays that way winning the game. But it is an escape and a pretty good one. And that makes his laning safe.

Imagine you are an immobile melee champ at top. For example: Singed. It is hard enough to get in Gnars range when he has slows with his Q and MS buff with his W (remember, it proccs off from minions as well, not just champions). And even _if_ you actually managed to get in range..... he can still just hop away with E in emergency. It is an additional safety net for him.

See, I don't even say that Gnar isn't supposed to build Frozen Mallet. But his kiting power is extremely strong, with **and** without that item. Did you see worlds last year? When they picked Gnar, the commentators used to say a specific phrase over and over again:

>Gnar: safe pick, no counter

And you could actually see this in the game. His laning was extremely safe because of his kiting and escape with E. He kept split pushing all game long and the enemy team mostly was not able to catch him at all, he always escaped with his mobility, tankiness and slows (partly because of Frozen Mallet).

When Gnars numbers are strong, he is pretty frustrating for melees to face. That's just how it is, I have to agree with OP here.

The reason Gnar was a safe pick was due to his E and safely farming with Q. Had literally nothing to do with his builds or his kiting. Mega Gnar was the entire reason you brought him to competitive along with the super safe laning. He could bully in some match-ups but that was also when his numbers were different.

You've confused the entire reason Gnar was strong and are linking it to an advantage he currently has via Frozen Mallet, rather than an advantage he has always had which is his safe laning. How can you engage on anyone halfway across the lane when he also has a gap closer to leave? Not even Riven can punish that. Tower dives are the only answer and in his Mega Form that is one of the riskiest plays to be making. I have 1v2'd before in that scenario.

Singed is actually one of the safest, if not THE safest counter to Frozen Mallet users if you're using the Dark Seal build and use your minion wave properly to punish the opponent's aggression. These champions do not carry enough hard CC to be overcoming proxy farms and Righteous Glory + Boots of Swiftness/Merc Treads.  And you actually play Singed! It may not be in a ranked setting but I would hope you've actually beaten some Frozen Mallet users. Maybe use one yourself instead of implying they're hard to beat?

Either way, Gnar's numbers when they are strong in MINI FORM make him a lane bully. They are not currently strong right now, seeing as he's consistently <450 range until lv10, compared to him getting that at lv6. When they are strong in Mega Form, which was the majority of his existence and is his current state, he is picked for doing what every tank wants to do in the game from chain CC and damage. Very hard to utilize in solo queue and there are champions that do his job consistently better, just like when he was released. Mind you he used to have both of these advantages with his older builds.

Lastly, Q gets blocked by minions/other champions and therefore turns impractical. The boost to his speed when his Mini form is not a lane bully in the current meta is meaningless, compared to things like Teemo who keep the mobility throughout the lane phase and get to boost it whenever they would absolutely need it. Gnar's Mini Form needs to be a threat or he is literally **useless.** Frozen Mallet is a means to that end and it is working better than literally anything else currently. If BoTRK was truly good him then that could've easily replaced it (it has before if you were paying attention at all to his previous build paths), but he's a tank and wants as much HP as possible. Also something Frozen Mallet fulfills. Gnar has had to build Frozen Mallet and Cleaver in over 60% of the games he plays and has a nonexistent winrate unless he follows this cookie cutter build in solo queue. He has literally no presence without them. That is a real problem and it's being ignored in favor of saying FM is too strong.

Frozen Mallet needs to be melee only in some way. 

I'd maybe even go as far as to say it should scale inversely with the range between you and your enemy when you hit them. That way it also hits weird abuse cases like Yasuo's Q, (which is the main one I feel should be hit) Poppy's passive and GP's Q.

Maybe a formula like 35/[(0.05x(range-200))][floor 1] could work. What this would mean is that up to 200 range it would be a 35% slow and after 200 range it would fall off insanely fast, for example at 250 range it would be a 14% slow, at 300 it would be a 7% slow and by a standard 550 range AA it would be an insignificant 2% slow.

Since I imagine this could be confusing as well, the "floor 1" means the lowest value the denominator can take is 1, if you're closer than 200 range then the slow snaps to a value of 35%, it never goes higher than that.

Reworking Frozen Mallet at this point means buffing/reworking the champions that are the best at using them. I've only seen the item in recent days being used by people like myself who use Kennen, Teemo, and Gnar (though not as much as the first two admittedly).

Teemo has no hard CC in his kit and going AP will undoubtedly lead to you get bursted most games. Heimerdinger can do what AP Teemo does right now much, much better aside from a surprise Shroom chunking people out, which is purely cheese. Gnar also has no hard CC unless he's in mega form, and a lot of the reason he isn't meta is because his small form is so easy to kick around and bully. Frozen Mallet/Cleaver combo is the only thing keeping him above ~44% winrate. On-hit Kennen is practically the only thing that uses Frozen Mallet as something extra.

Regardless, top laners who take Frozen Mallet as ranged attackers use it to be a pseudo ADC, and without it would be well...a worse ADC. Only Gnar has an attack speed steroid usable in combat, and it's not really good to use it for dueling. These champions are hovering below 50% winrate currently and really only excel in specific match-ups. Things like Jayce do not rely on Frozen Mallet to smash melees, and that's the only thing Teemo practically excels at until he gets his items rolling.

I'm not saying that the item shouldn't be reworked, but Boots of Swiftness after its nerfspree is more core to the issue than you would think. That and the champions currently using Mallet as a true staple for on-hit builds are reliant on the item doing its intended purpose.
Kennen needs a nerf.
